"""WIBTA if I snitch to my boss, that my nice coworker isn’t doing her job? | My job recently hired a new girl. We became instant friends due to being the only girls on our graphic design team, similar interests and close in age. She funny and super nice. She already told me so much about her life despite knowing me for about a month now. 

The problem comes in that when it comes to the job duties she severely slacks. She doesn’t follow the design templates, plays on her phone most of the time or skimp details when we’re designing ads. (E.i. Forgets the picture completely or doesn’t use the right font or color.). She spends most of time talking to me or playing on the computer. 

It’s gotten to the point that our Senior Creative Director told me he wants me to retrain her. I’ve tried but she keeps making the same mistakes. Every time she does something wrong, he pulls me aside and tells me not to make the same mistake she did. Out of the 50 mistakes she makes in a week, the director only knows about 3 tops. I don’t like throwing people under the bus. So I cover when I can or act like it’s news to me when the director finds out. Doesn’t help she constantly puts my name on her projects as well. 

For awhile now she’s been using our ink/paper/funds for a her own freelance work. During my shift today, I mentioned to the director that we ran out of ink since I needed to out design plans for a meeting. He was confused since he put in new ink over the weekend and it’s only Monday. So he checked the print list and it was all the new girl. 

He gave a lecture about the ink isn’t for her freelance use, which turned into a critique of her duties and comparing her to me. Basically “Blitznyx would’ve done this. She did the design the right way. Take her example. etc.”. She is now giving me the cold shoulder or attitude. I’m tired of this and her entire work ethic. But soon her lack of work with reflect badly on me. I’m thinking about just telling the director EVERYTHING and have her be his problem. 


WIBTA

Update: It’s her day off today and I’m looking through her files to see if she put my name on any. Well her deadline is tomorrow and has gotten barely anything done. She just has a sketch and yes she put my name on it. So instead of finishing my work that’s due Friday, I have to rush to do hers. If I don’t, I’m guaranteed to get in trouble."""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for going hard in sparring against beginners who think they're better than they are? | I do Jiu Jitsu, have been for the past 5 years. For those unfamiliar it's a grappling martial art, lots of armlocks, chokeholds, leglocks etc. It has a belt system, like most other arts White is the first belt you're on. Then blue, purple, brown, black. 

I've been at the same gym since I first started, seen heaps of people come and go. One thing that irks me like nothing else are 'White Belts coaches'.. they will go to other white belts and sometimes even more senior belts and confidently try and correct their technique, or show them something they learnt off YouTube before they came to class, most of the time what they're spewing is completely wrong and almost dangerous to an extent. It shits me to no end, I've politely corrected people before but it doesn't really seem to register with them.

What I tend to do nowadays is offer to spar with them, and I will go near on 100% and try to submit them as many times as possible in embarassing ways, and usually go to the positions they're trying to show their techniques from and shut them down completely in front of our other classmates. Sounds harsh but the way I see it, people need an ego check now and then, but on the other hand sometimes I think it's probably me with the ego. The way I see it though if you're a white belt you should just stfu, listen and absorb from the coaches. The exception being maybe if you already come from a wrestling, judo, or MMA background.

On a closing note I'll add that I don't act this way to your regular white belts, I'll just match their intensity when we spar and let them work.

Edit: from the comments people assume I'm maiming and permanently injuring people, sending people home with broken bones and leaving a trail of bodies on the mat. That's my fault for not clarifying in the OP. I'll stress that this is very much aggressive, but controlled aggression, when I say 100% I mean I would use the same amount of aggression I would against someone of my own rank or higher. It's very physical but after 5 years I know enough to implement my offence without taking someone off the mats with an injury. I'm not dumping people on their necks headfirst, grabbing their leg and cranking it until it I hear their knee rip apart ...chill."""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for disagreeing with our HR? | I am a 7 month newly hired employee for a big corporation. Last night our HR sent out a five page memo to all employees titled "Office Discipline". Basically, they were reminding everyone of the various rules around the office. Like not loitering during office hours, sticking to our lunch schedules, the correct dress code, wearing of IDs at all times etc. In my 6 month stay here our HR hasn't issued me an office ID card. Despite their large number of employees (they have an entire floor to themselves unlike multiple departments in one floor), they are slow. They took about 5 months to process my payroll alone, so the delay in ID cards are not a surprise to us. Everyone without an office ID just started using government issued IDs to be able to enter our building but this morning, security started telling everyone that starting next week anyone without an ID will have their names be noted and be reported to HR. I promptly called HR when I got to my desk to ask for a status for my (and my other colleagues) ID. They told me that they can't print our IDs yet because the team in charge is swarmed with other "projects" and suggested that we can print our own IDs, and gave us the template. My colleagues and I disagreed with this. We argued that we don't want to make up for the short comings of HR, by shelling out money from our own pockets to print our IDs, and that it should have been provided to us in the first place. We plan on just keep using whatever IDs we have right now be damned whatever happens next week. So, AITA for disagreeing with our HR?"""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for giving my girlfriend an ultimatum over an app? | Found out my girlfriend reinstalled tinder at her best friends bachelorette party 3ish months ago and hid it from me. She still had the app on her phone,  and would browse it. Had an updated picture and profile and blocked my account. Nothing suggestive.

Told her straight I won't continue seeing her unless she gets rid of the account and app. She did and understand my point of view, although after accusing me of trust issues.

Her bestfriend messages me to reassure me she never cheated and it was my problem. I simply didn't understand their asian culture[im western living with an asian gf in asia] and She would be fine if her husband used tinder etc. I told her thats fine but I am not comfortable with my girlfriend browsing dating apps in secret. 

Her best friend since then told my gf that she doesnt like me and she doesn't want me around her or her husband again. My gf is now conflicted because her best friend from childhood is basically cutting me and indirectly her off from them. 

AITA in this situation? 

Can explain in more details as needed without doxing myself.

INFO- i found out because my girlfriend kept hiding her phone from me when I walked by. This was a new behavior since the party. It kept bothering me in my mind, so I reinstalled [i had not deleted my account just the app which is 100% inactive since dating her] tinder and found her account gone. Told myself she must have deleted it and so removed the app and my account this time. But I was still getting red flags and recreated an account and lowered the distance and narrowed age and found her account quickly. I was pretty destroyed. She admitted it to having it after I told her that.

Update: I am trying to speak further with her about it and hopefully we can work it out because I do care about her; but will be careful moving forward. 

Thank you to everyone who gave support and let me know I am not crazy for feeling this way. Was suprised to get off work and see so many comments and votes. Really does help."""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for not telling my child about his dad? | I was with Michael for 8 months, after breaking up I found out I was pregnant.

AITA?"""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for not letting my daughter attend her friend's church? | My family is all Catholic and I'm from an almost all Irish family. Basically everyone in the extended tree on both sides is Catholic, though many non-practicing. We're not very practicing either honestly, probably attend Mass around once a month besides special events and holidays, but we're still very Catholic if you know what I mean.

My daughter was confirmed about a year ago. I told her we wouldn't force her to attend Mass anymore after that and she basically quit going. A few months ago she became close to a Protestant friend and going to her youth group with her. Later she started asking if she could go to church Sunday evenings with the friend. I told her no, she's not going to a non-Catholic church. She told me I'm no longer requiring her to go to Mass so there should be no point, I said that doesn't mean she's allowed to attend other churches. Her choices are go to Mass or not attend at all. I also later forbid her from going to youth group and gave the same choice: Catholic youth group or none.

My husband thinks I'm being unnecessarily rigid. Am I?"""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for not telling my boss I live near the "projects"? | I currently live next to an apartment complex for people on rental assistance. I am not on RA, but the rent is cheaper and it’s not in the best area. I work as a nanny 20 minutes away in a different town and you would think it was a totally different county because of how much nicer it is. Pretty much everyone there has a nanny, everyone is wealthy, mostly private schools, etc. Now, the city I live in isn’t all poor, it’s pretty diverse in terms of income, I just happen to live in the poorer part. And when I got the job, my boss didn’t inquire where I lived specifically. I always went to their house to work and even when I picked up the two older kids, I brought them directly home.

Last week, however, the mother was having some of her friends over because one of the women is moving abroad. She asked if I would mind having the kids over to my house. My home isn’t in an unsafe area, it’s just not the best in comparison to hers. Even so, I didn’t think of it as an issue. When the time came, I packed up some toys for the kids and brought the youngest with me to pick up her brothers and we went to my house. We played at the park nearby before going back to my place to watch some movies and play. The dad came by to pick them up, thanked me and left. No big deal, or so I thought.

The next day, the mom reprimanded me for not telling her exactly where I lived and asked why I thought “the projects” (as she called them) were a safe place for her kids and why I didn’t tell her. I tried to explain that I didn’t think it was a huge deal and she never asked. Plus when I gave her my address, she could’ve figured it out as the street is well known for the area. She told me that she was probably being too protective but next time she would have me bring them elsewhere (like her mother’s, which I’ve done in the past as I know her mom well). The dad later said not to worry about it, he only told the wife because about 10 years ago (way before I moved in) there was a shooting in the area. (I didn’t know that.)

AITA for not telling them where I lived?"""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for shaming a cashier for helping another customer? | I went grocery shopping last night. I got the same cashier who forgot to put an entire bag of groceries of mine last week. I was annoyed, but let it go. I didn't have much this time, just a three items. He scanned one item and the cashier next to him said he got locked out in the middle of a transaction. The person he was checking had a shitload of groceries. My cashier stopped to help him out and took 10x longer to fix the problem than it would have to have checked me out. He kept me waiting. 

When he came back, I asked why he couldn't have just finished checking me out before dealing with the drama in the other lane. He mentioned that it didn't take long and I corrected him that it took TOO long and unlike him, I'm not being paid. Then I mentioned how he forgot an entire bag of groceries last week and the problem is him and to get it right.

ANNNNNNNNNNNNNDDDDDDDDDD yes, I worked at a grocery store during college too."""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for banning my daughter from seeing her best friend until she gets vaccinated | My daughter is 17 and still lives at home. Her best friend has an anti-vaxx mom. She’s not crazy or spreading misinformation or encouraging others to not vaccinate on FaceBook or anything. Her oldest daughter had a reaction so she made the decision to not vaccinate her younger daughter (a decision I disagree with). I have let our daughters be around each other from a young age despite protest from my husband, but in light of everything that’s been happening with preventable diseases coming back, I want to keep my daughter healthy and safe. My daughter’s friend has said that when she’s 18 (in 5 months) she’ll get all her vaccines herself. AITA for banning my daughter from seeing her until she gets her vaccines? She can still call, text, and communicate with her, but is not allowed to see her in person. My daughter is understandably upset because it means that she’ll miss her best friend’s graduation (daughter is homeschooled, friend goes to public) and their last summer together before leaving for college. My husband is firm about this and says that she’ll thank us later. I’m not so sure."""

"""AITA for complaining to HR about my coworker | Hello,
So I am a student and I have a part time job. I work long hours and I have important standardized tests to study for to prepare for grad school as well as balance an internship. I work a lot of hours sometimes up to 12 a day. One day I worked 7 hours and I got a call from “joe” in the office . He works in scheduling and asked if I wanted to pick up a  6 hours shift. I said “no, I am tired and I have some things to do after this shift .” He responded with : “well what do you have to do that you can’t pick up the shift.” 
I got annoyed, told him
I don’t have to explain myself . And hung up. The same instance repeats for weeks ... I pick up shifts frequently but I’m human for goodness sakes ! I need a break and have a life outside of this “part time “ job!


So a few days ago I do an on call shift . At my job the moment you clock into on call you are paid regardless . If you are on call 8AM-6PM, you are paid 10 hours even if you were only called in for 1. I called him and reminded him I am working on call Saturday . He agreed and said he would note that in my portal. I got called in for a 2 hour shift. I called Monday to clarify that I get my 10 hours and he says no I “picked up a shift I was not on call”
I lost it . I got bat crazy and tell him I need my extra 8 hours. I cleared my day on call waiting to get called in and got called in. Picking up a shift would be me calling in before or getting a choice to go in. I complained to HR , he was scolded and I got my full 10 hours and an extra 2 as well as a bonus. They apologized . A few weeks later he was pulled from scheduling to another position as they said a lot of people have had issues with him
In the scheduling section of the office. I still feel bad though. I feel like I tipped the cup over. AITA?"""

AITA for complaining to HR about my coworker | Hello,
So I am a student and I have a part time job. I work long hours and I have important standardized tests to study for to prepare for grad school as well as balance an internship. I work a lot of hours sometimes up to 12 a day. One day I worked 7 hours and I got a call from “joe” in the office . He works in scheduling and asked if I wanted to pick up a  6 hours shift. I said “no, I am tired and I have some things to do after this shift .” He responded with : “well what do you have to do that you can’t pick up the shift.” 
I got annoyed, told him
I don’t have to explain myself . And hung up. The same instance repeats for weeks ... I pick up shifts frequently but I’m human for goodness sakes ! I need a break and have a life outside of this “part time “ job!


So a few days ago I do an on call shift . At my job the moment you clock into on call you are paid regardless . If you are on call 8AM-6PM, you are paid 10 hours even if you were only called in for 1. I called him and reminded him I am working on call Saturday . He agreed and said he would note that in my portal. I got called in for a 2 hour shift. I called Monday to clarify that I get my 10 hours and he says no I “picked up a shift I was not on call”
I lost it . I got bat crazy and tell him I need my extra 8 hours. I cleared my day on call waiting to get called in and got called in. Picking up a shift would be me calling in before or getting a choice to go in. I complained to HR , he was scolded and I got my full 10 hours and an extra 2 as well as a bonus. They apologized . A few weeks later he was pulled from scheduling to another position as they said a lot of people have had issues with him
In the scheduling section of the office. I still feel bad though. I feel like I tipped the cup over. AITA?

"""AITA for going hard in sparring against beginners who think they're better than they are? | I do Jiu Jitsu, have been for the past 5 years. For those unfamiliar it's a grappling martial art, lots of armlocks, chokeholds, leglocks etc. It has a belt system, like most other arts White is the first belt you're on. Then blue, purple, brown, black. 

I've been at the same gym since I first started, seen heaps of people come and go. One thing that irks me like nothing else are 'White Belts coaches'.. they will go to other white belts and sometimes even more senior belts and confidently try and correct their technique, or show them something they learnt off YouTube before they came to class, most of the time what they're spewing is completely wrong and almost dangerous to an extent. It shits me to no end, I've politely corrected people before but it doesn't really seem to register with them.

What I tend to do nowadays is offer to spar with them, and I will go near on 100% and try to submit them as many times as possible in embarassing ways, and usually go to the positions they're trying to show their techniques from and shut them down completely in front of our other classmates. Sounds harsh but the way I see it, people need an ego check now and then, but on the other hand sometimes I think it's probably me with the ego. The way I see it though if you're a white belt you should just stfu, listen and absorb from the coaches. The exception being maybe if you already come from a wrestling, judo, or MMA background.

On a closing note I'll add that I don't act this way to your regular white belts, I'll just match their intensity when we spar and let them work.

Edit: from the comments people assume I'm maiming and permanently injuring people, sending people home with broken bones and leaving a trail of bodies on the mat. That's my fault for not clarifying in the OP. I'll stress that this is very much aggressive, but controlled aggression, when I say 100% I mean I would use the same amount of aggression I would against someone of my own rank or higher. It's very physical but after 5 years I know enough to implement my offence without taking someone off the mats with an injury. I'm not dumping people on their necks headfirst, grabbing their leg and cranking it until it I hear their knee rip apart ...chill."""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for not letting my daughter attend her friend's church? | My family is all Catholic and I'm from an almost all Irish family. Basically everyone in the extended tree on both sides is Catholic, though many non-practicing. We're not very practicing either honestly, probably attend Mass around once a month besides special events and holidays, but we're still very Catholic if you know what I mean.

My daughter was confirmed about a year ago. I told her we wouldn't force her to attend Mass anymore after that and she basically quit going. A few months ago she became close to a Protestant friend and going to her youth group with her. Later she started asking if she could go to church Sunday evenings with the friend. I told her no, she's not going to a non-Catholic church. She told me I'm no longer requiring her to go to Mass so there should be no point, I said that doesn't mean she's allowed to attend other churches. Her choices are go to Mass or not attend at all. I also later forbid her from going to youth group and gave the same choice: Catholic youth group or none.

My husband thinks I'm being unnecessarily rigid. Am I?"""

"""AITA for not telling my boss I live near the "projects"? | I currently live next to an apartment complex for people on rental assistance. I am not on RA, but the rent is cheaper and it’s not in the best area. I work as a nanny 20 minutes away in a different town and you would think it was a totally different county because of how much nicer it is. Pretty much everyone there has a nanny, everyone is wealthy, mostly private schools, etc. Now, the city I live in isn’t all poor, it’s pretty diverse in terms of income, I just happen to live in the poorer part. And when I got the job, my boss didn’t inquire where I lived specifically. I always went to their house to work and even when I picked up the two older kids, I brought them directly home.

Last week, however, the mother was having some of her friends over because one of the women is moving abroad. She asked if I would mind having the kids over to my house. My home isn’t in an unsafe area, it’s just not the best in comparison to hers. Even so, I didn’t think of it as an issue. When the time came, I packed up some toys for the kids and brought the youngest with me to pick up her brothers and we went to my house. We played at the park nearby before going back to my place to watch some movies and play. The dad came by to pick them up, thanked me and left. No big deal, or so I thought.

The next day, the mom reprimanded me for not telling her exactly where I lived and asked why I thought “the projects” (as she called them) were a safe place for her kids and why I didn’t tell her. I tried to explain that I didn’t think it was a huge deal and she never asked. Plus when I gave her my address, she could’ve figured it out as the street is well known for the area. She told me that she was probably being too protective but next time she would have me bring them elsewhere (like her mother’s, which I’ve done in the past as I know her mom well). The dad later said not to worry about it, he only told the wife because about 10 years ago (way before I moved in) there was a shooting in the area. (I didn’t know that.)

AITA for not telling them where I lived?"""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for shaming a cashier for helping another customer? | I went grocery shopping last night. I got the same cashier who forgot to put an entire bag of groceries of mine last week. I was annoyed, but let it go. I didn't have much this time, just a three items. He scanned one item and the cashier next to him said he got locked out in the middle of a transaction. The person he was checking had a shitload of groceries. My cashier stopped to help him out and took 10x longer to fix the problem than it would have to have checked me out. He kept me waiting. 

When he came back, I asked why he couldn't have just finished checking me out before dealing with the drama in the other lane. He mentioned that it didn't take long and I corrected him that it took TOO long and unlike him, I'm not being paid. Then I mentioned how he forgot an entire bag of groceries last week and the problem is him and to get it right.

ANNNNNNNNNNNNNDDDDDDDDDD yes, I worked at a grocery store during college too."""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for not wanting my mom to sue my dad for child support? | 
TLDR; dying father owes mom child support. He was going to leave my sister and I money but my mom wants to take the money for the back child support. AITA for being upset?


Mine (21 f) and my sister’s (24) mom and dad divorced when we were very young. I’ll admit my dad has been an asshole in the past, but they’ve always had a custody agreement. We would visit my dad most weekends and in between he would call and send cute letters and stuff. He has some issues such as temperament but it’s because when he was younger he got thyroid cancer after serving in the Air Force and they removed his whole thyroid and his meds don’t help a lot with keeping his hormones in balance. 

Anyways, he didn’t pay a lot of child support when I was growing up because he’s always been extremely poor. Not only that, but my mom had a huge problem with accruing debt. We lived with my grandma growing up and she would take out credit cards in my grandmas name, max them out, and then not pay them. She’d also buy a ton of clothes with the money that was supposed to go to bills, so occasionally our water or electricity would get shut off. So he didn’t want her to spend all that money on herself instead of us girls. 

A couple years ago she got my grandmas ( moms mom) house that we had lived in since I was 3 foreclosed on, even though it had a reverse mortgage. She didn’t have to pay on the mortgage all those years, she just wouldn’t pay the property tax until eventually they wanted a ton of money and she didn’t have it so it got foreclosed. 

So now, my dad has been diagnosed with stage 4 metastatic prostate cancer. He’s making all of his death arrangements while he’s been going through treatment.  

My mom told me that because my grandma on my dads side is so rich (and she also has stage 4 cancer in her breasts that metastasized to lungs and lymph nodes)  she’s going to try to take the money my dad owes her out of his inheritance from my grandma. 

I’m upset because not only is she trying to go after my dying father and grandmother, she would be taking the money that my dad was going to leave to my sister and I. I know it’s shitty that he didn’t pay his child support all the way but he’s been sending her $20 a month because that’s all he has now and he didn’t want to give it to her just for her to spend it on herself instead of us and the bills because she was doing a shitty job of taking care of us. 

I don’t want to be a spoiled brat and say “that’s my money!!” Because it’s not, but she’s trying to go after my dying father and grandmother that I love a lot. And also it just seems a little shitty to take your children’s inheritance,  even if that person owes you money.

I hope I explained that okay."""

My home isn’t in an unsafe area, it’s just not the best in comparison to hers. Even so, I didn’t think of it as an issue. When the time came, I packed up some toys for the kids and brought the youngest with me to pick up her brothers and we went to my house. We played at the park nearby before going back to my place to watch some movies and play. The dad came by to pick them up, thanked me and left. No big deal, or so I thought.

The next day, the mom reprimanded me for not telling her exactly where I lived and asked why I thought “the projects” (as she called them) were a safe place for her kids and why I didn’t tell her. I tried to explain that I didn’t think it was a huge deal and she never asked. Plus when I gave her my address, she could’ve figured it out as the street is well known for the area. She told me that she was probably being too protective but next time she would have me bring them elsewhere (like her mother’s, which I’ve done in the past as I know her mom well). The dad later said not to worry about it, he only told the wife because about 10 years ago (way before I moved in) there was a shooting in the area. (I didn’t know that.)

AITA for not telling them where I lived?"""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for shaming a cashier for helping another customer? | I went grocery shopping last night. I got the same cashier who forgot to put an entire bag of groceries of mine last week. I was annoyed, but let it go. I didn't have much this time, just a three items. He scanned one item and the cashier next to him said he got locked out in the middle of a transaction. The person he was checking had a shitload of groceries. My cashier stopped to help him out and took 10x longer to fix the problem than it would have to have checked me out. He kept me waiting. 

When he came back, I asked why he couldn't have just finished checking me out before dealing with the drama in the other lane. He mentioned that it didn't take long and I corrected him that it took TOO long and unlike him, I'm not being paid. Then I mentioned how he forgot an entire bag of groceries last week and the problem is him and to get it right.

ANNNNNNNNNNNNNDDDDDDDDDD yes, I worked at a grocery store during college too."""
Verdict: wrong

test_prompt:
"""WIBTA if I snitch to my boss, that my nice coworker isn’t doing her job? | My job recently hired a new girl. We became instant friends due to being the only girls on our graphic design team, similar interests and close in age. She funny and super nice. She already told me so much about her life despite knowing me for about a month now. 

The problem comes in that when it comes to the job duties she severely slacks. She doesn’t follow the design templates, plays on her phone most of the time or skimp details when we’re designing ads. (E.i. Forgets the picture completely or doesn’t use the right font or color.). She spends most of time talking to me or playing on the computer. 

It’s gotten to the point that our Senior Creative Director told me he wants me to retrain her. I’ve tried but she keeps making the same mistakes. Every time she does something wrong, he pulls me aside and tells me not to make the same mistake she did. Out of the 50 mistakes she makes in a week, the director only knows about 3 tops. I don’t like throwing people under the bus. So I cover when I can or act like it’s news to me when the director finds out. Doesn’t help she constantly puts my name on her projects as well. 

For awhile now she’s been using our ink/paper/funds for a her own freelance work. During my shift today, I mentioned to the director that we ran out of ink since I needed to out design plans for a meeting. He was confused since he put in new ink over the weekend and it’s only Monday. So he checked the print list and it was all the new girl. 

He gave a lecture about the ink isn’t for her freelance use, which turned into a critique of her duties and comparing her to me. Basically “Blitznyx would’ve done this. She did the design the right way. Take her example. etc.”. She is now giving me the cold shoulder or attitude. I’m tired of this and her entire work ethic. But soon her lack of work with reflect badly on me. I’m thinking about just telling the director EVERYTHING and have her be his problem. 


WIBTA

Update: It’s her day off today and I’m looking through her files to see if she put my name on any. Well her deadline is tomorrow and has gotten barely anything done. She just has a sketch and yes she put my name on it. So instead of finishing my work that’s due Friday, I have to rush to do hers. If I don’t, I’m guaranteed to get in trouble."""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for going hard in sparring against beginners who think they're better than they are? | I do Jiu Jitsu, have been for the past 5 years. For those unfamiliar it's a grappling martial art, lots of armlocks, chokeholds, leglocks etc. It has a belt system, like most other arts White is the first belt you're on. Then blue, purple, brown, black. 

I've been at the same gym since I first started, seen heaps of people come and go. One thing that irks me like nothing else are 'White Belts coaches'.. they will go to other white belts and sometimes even more senior belts and confidently try and correct their technique, or show them something they learnt off YouTube before they came to class, most of the time what they're spewing is completely wrong and almost dangerous to an extent. It shits me to no end, I've politely corrected people before but it doesn't really seem to register with them.

What I tend to do nowadays is offer to spar with them, and I will go near on 100% and try to submit them as many times as possible in embarassing ways, and usually go to the positions they're trying to show their techniques from and shut them down completely in front of our other classmates. Sounds harsh but the way I see it, people need an ego check now and then, but on the other hand sometimes I think it's probably me with the ego. The way I see it though if you're a white belt you should just stfu, listen and absorb from the coaches. The exception being maybe if you already come from a wrestling, judo, or MMA background.

On a closing note I'll add that I don't act this way to your regular white belts, I'll just match their intensity when we spar and let them work.

Edit: from the comments people assume I'm maiming and permanently injuring people, sending people home with broken bones and leaving a trail of bodies on the mat. That's my fault for not clarifying in the OP. I'll stress that this is very much aggressive, but controlled aggression, when I say 100% I mean I would use the same amount of aggression I would against someone of my own rank or higher. It's very physical but after 5 years I know enough to implement my offence without taking someone off the mats with an injury. I'm not dumping people on their necks headfirst, grabbing their leg and cranking it until it I hear their knee rip apart ...chill."""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for disagreeing with our HR? | I am a 7 month newly hired employee for a big corporation. Last night our HR sent out a five page memo to all employees titled "Office Discipline". Basically, they were reminding everyone of the various rules around the office. Like not loitering during office hours, sticking to our lunch schedules, the correct dress code, wearing of IDs at all times etc. In my 6 month stay here our HR hasn't issued me an office ID card. Despite their large number of employees (they have an entire floor to themselves unlike multiple departments in one floor), they are slow. They took about 5 months to process my payroll alone, so the delay in ID cards are not a surprise to us. Everyone without an office ID just started using government issued IDs to be able to enter our building but this morning, security started telling everyone that starting next week anyone without an ID will have their names be noted and be reported to HR. I promptly called HR when I got to my desk to ask for a status for my (and my other colleagues) ID. They told me that they can't print our IDs yet because the team in charge is swarmed with other "projects" and suggested that we can print our own IDs, and gave us the template. My colleagues and I disagreed with this. We argued that we don't want to make up for the short comings of HR, by shelling out money from our own pockets to print our IDs, and that it should have been provided to us in the first place. We plan on just keep using whatever IDs we have right now be damned whatever happens next week. So, AITA for disagreeing with our HR?"""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for giving my girlfriend an ultimatum over an app? | Found out my girlfriend reinstalled tinder at her best friends bachelorette party 3ish months ago and hid it from me. She still had the app on her phone,  and would browse it. Had an updated picture and profile and blocked my account. Nothing suggestive.

Told her straight I won't continue seeing her unless she gets rid of the account and app. She did and understand my point of view, although after accusing me of trust issues.

Her bestfriend messages me to reassure me she never cheated and it was my problem. I simply didn't understand their asian culture[im western living with an asian gf in asia] and She would be fine if her husband used tinder etc. I told her thats fine but I am not comfortable with my girlfriend browsing dating apps in secret. 

Her best friend since then told my gf that she doesnt like me and she doesn't want me around her or her husband again. My gf is now conflicted because her best friend from childhood is basically cutting me and indirectly her off from them. 

AITA in this situation? 

Can explain in more details as needed without doxing myself.

INFO- i found out because my girlfriend kept hiding her phone from me when I walked by. This was a new behavior since the party. It kept bothering me in my mind, so I reinstalled [i had not deleted my account just the app which is 100% inactive since dating her] tinder and found her account gone. Told myself she must have deleted it and so removed the app and my account this time. But I was still getting red flags and recreated an account and lowered the distance and narrowed age and found her account quickly. I was pretty destroyed. She admitted it to having it after I told her that.

Update: I am trying to speak further with her about it and hopefully we can work it out because I do care about her; but will be careful moving forward. 

Thank you to everyone who gave support and let me know I am not crazy for feeling this way. Was suprised to get off work and see so many comments and votes. Really does help."""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for not letting my daughter attend her friend's church? | My family is all Catholic and I'm from an almost all Irish family. I also later forbid her from going to youth group and gave the same choice: Catholic youth group or none.

My husband thinks I'm being unnecessarily rigid. Am I?"""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for banning my roommate from Just Dance? | I live in a house with four roommates. We use my PlayStation in the living room for our main source entertainment (TV & Video games).

I have the game Just Dance, and we all play it together. One of my roommates, Jada, is a professional dancer and choreographer. She destroys us at this game every time we play together. It’s supposed to be fun, but nobody but Jada ever wins. 

Last night we were all playing together, and it seemed like we were having a fun time, but then the game became all about beating Jada. I have even seen my other roommates practicing the game to beat her. It ruins the fun. 

I told Jada she couldn’t play the game anymore. Everyone thought that I was joking, but I wasn’t. I don’t think Jada should be allowed to play so that we can have a fair game for once. It’s my PlayStation and my game. Everyone got quiet and went to their rooms after that. I sent around an text in group chat to see if everyone is ok , and they all said that they were, but Jada did not respond. Today, however, everyone is being short with me, and staying in their rooms rather than taking to me. I’m wondering if I am just overthinking things, or if I did an asshole thing. AITA?"""

He hates this every time I do it, but he doesn’t bark or yell. He just sort of looks at me like, “Did you just really disrespect me like this father?” So the question is, am I the asshole?"""

test_sample.input: AITA So I found a way to make my dog cringe | This is my first story on this subreddit. Ok. Hear me out. So I own a cute pug mix who’s more on the healthier side of pugs so he’s well built. Loves to lie around when he can, but he gets super excited whenever the time comes. One thing for sure he hates are baths or anything water related to his fur. When I’m washing dishes or just near the kitchen sink, he’s usually near my feet or just lying around on the floor. One day, my hands are soaking wet, I walk over to him and just cup his cheeks all lovingly. His face just looked like he ate a lemon and he also tries to pull away from me. He hates this every time I do it, but he doesn’t bark or yell. He just sort of looks at me like, “Did you just really disrespect me like this father?” So the question is, am I the asshole?

test_prompt:
"""WIBTA if I snitch to my boss, that my nice coworker isn’t doing her job? | My job recently hired a new girl. We became instant friends due to being the only girls on our graphic design team, similar interests and close in age. She funny and super nice. She already told me so much about her life despite knowing me for about a month now. 

The problem comes in that when it comes to the job duties she severely slacks. She doesn’t follow the design templates, plays on her phone most of the time or skimp details when we’re designing ads. (E.i. Forgets the picture completely or doesn’t use the right font or color.). She spends most of time talking to me or playing on the computer. 

It’s gotten to the point that our Senior Creative Director told me he wants me to retrain her. I’ve tried but she keeps making the same mistakes. Every time she does something wrong, he pulls me aside and tells me not to make the same mistake she did. Out of the 50 mistakes she makes in a week, the director only knows about 3 tops. I don’t like throwing people under the bus. So I cover when I can or act like it’s news to me when the director finds out. Doesn’t help she constantly puts my name on her projects as well. 

For awhile now she’s been using our ink/paper/funds for a her own freelance work. During my shift today, I mentioned to the director that we ran out of ink since I needed to out design plans for a meeting. He was confused since he put in new ink over the weekend and it’s only Monday. So he checked the print list and it was all the new girl. 

He gave a lecture about the ink isn’t for her freelance use, which turned into a critique of her duties and comparing her to me. Basically “Blitznyx would’ve done this. She did the design the right way. Take her example. etc.”. She is now giving me the cold shoulder or attitude. I’m tired of this and her entire work ethic. But soon her lack of work with reflect badly on me. I’m thinking about just telling the director EVERYTHING and have her be his problem. 


WIBTA

Update: It’s her day off today and I’m looking through her files to see if she put my name on any. Well her deadline is tomorrow and has gotten barely anything done. She just has a sketch and yes she put my name on it. So instead of finishing my work that’s due Friday, I have to rush to do hers. If I don’t, I’m guaranteed to get in trouble."""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for going hard in sparring against beginners who think they're better than they are? | I do Jiu Jitsu, have been for the past 5 years. For those unfamiliar it's a grappling martial art, lots of armlocks, chokeholds, leglocks etc. It has a belt system, like most other arts White is the first belt you're on. Then blue, purple, brown, black. 

I've been at the same gym since I first started, seen heaps of people come and go. One thing that irks me like nothing else are 'White Belts coaches'.. they will go to other white belts and sometimes even more senior belts and confidently try and correct their technique, or show them something they learnt off YouTube before they came to class, most of the time what they're spewing is completely wrong and almost dangerous to an extent. It shits me to no end, I've politely corrected people before but it doesn't really seem to register with them.

What I tend to do nowadays is offer to spar with them, and I will go near on 100% and try to submit them as many times as possible in embarassing ways, and usually go to the positions they're trying to show their techniques from and shut them down completely in front of our other classmates. Sounds harsh but the way I see it, people need an ego check now and then, but on the other hand sometimes I think it's probably me with the ego. The way I see it though if you're a white belt you should just stfu, listen and absorb from the coaches. The exception being maybe if you already come from a wrestling, judo, or MMA background.

On a closing note I'll add that I don't act this way to your regular white belts, I'll just match their intensity when we spar and let them work.

Edit: from the comments people assume I'm maiming and permanently injuring people, sending people home with broken bones and leaving a trail of bodies on the mat. That's my fault for not clarifying in the OP. I'll stress that this is very much aggressive, but controlled aggression, when I say 100% I mean I would use the same amount of aggression I would against someone of my own rank or higher. It's very physical but after 5 years I know enough to implement my offence without taking someone off the mats with an injury. I'm not dumping people on their necks headfirst, grabbing their leg and cranking it until it I hear their knee rip apart ...chill."""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for disagreeing with our HR? | I am a 7 month newly hired employee for a big corporation. Last night our HR sent out a five page memo to all employees titled "Office Discipline". Basically, they were reminding everyone of the various rules around the office. Like not loitering during office hours, sticking to our lunch schedules, the correct dress code, wearing of IDs at all times etc. In my 6 month stay here our HR hasn't issued me an office ID card. Despite their large number of employees (they have an entire floor to themselves unlike multiple departments in one floor), they are slow. They took about 5 months to process my payroll alone, so the delay in ID cards are not a surprise to us. Everyone without an office ID just started using government issued IDs to be able to enter our building but this morning, security started telling everyone that starting next week anyone without an ID will have their names be noted and be reported to HR. I promptly called HR when I got to my desk to ask for a status for my (and my other colleagues) ID. They told me that they can't print our IDs yet because the team in charge is swarmed with other "projects" and suggested that we can print our own IDs, and gave us the template. My colleagues and I disagreed with this. We argued that we don't want to make up for the short comings of HR, by shelling out money from our own pockets to print our IDs, and that it should have been provided to us in the first place. We plan on just keep using whatever IDs we have right now be damned whatever happens next week. So, AITA for disagreeing with our HR?"""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for giving my girlfriend an ultimatum over an app? | Found out my girlfriend reinstalled tinder at her best friends bachelorette party 3ish months ago and hid it from me. She still had the app on her phone,  and would browse it. Had an updated picture and profile and blocked my account. Nothing suggestive.

Told her straight I won't continue seeing her unless she gets rid of the account and app. She did and understand my point of view, although after accusing me of trust issues.

Her bestfriend messages me to reassure me she never cheated and it was my problem. I simply didn't understand their asian culture[im western living with an asian gf in asia] and She would be fine if her husband used tinder etc. I told her thats fine but I am not comfortable with my girlfriend browsing dating apps in secret. 

Her best friend since then told my gf that she doesnt like me and she doesn't want me around her or her husband again. My gf is now conflicted because her best friend from childhood is basically cutting me and indirectly her off from them. 

AITA in this situation? 

Can explain in more details as needed without doxing myself.

INFO- i found out because my girlfriend kept hiding her phone from me when I walked by. This was a new behavior since the party. It kept bothering me in my mind, so I reinstalled [i had not deleted my account just the app which is 100% inactive since dating her] tinder and found her account gone. Told myself she must have deleted it and so removed the app and my account this time. But I was still getting red flags and recreated an account and lowered the distance and narrowed age and found her account quickly. I was pretty destroyed. She admitted it to having it after I told her that.

Update: I am trying to speak further with her about it and hopefully we can work it out because I do care about her; but will be careful moving forward. 

Thank you to everyone who gave support and let me know I am not crazy for feeling this way. Was suprised to get off work and see so many comments and votes. Really does help."""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for not telling my child about his dad? | I was with Michael for 8 months, after breaking up I found out I was pregnant.

Michael was around every day for those 9 months 

When our son was born Michael paid child support, he always paid extra.

Michael was around for the first 3 years until I met my husband.

We both agreed it would be better for our son to have a normal family.

Michael was studying to get his doctorate at that time.

Last I heard Michael had gotten married and has two daughters.



Michael paid  support up until 4 years ago.

My son is now 24.

We recently made the choice to tell him about Michael.

He hasn't spoken to us since.

ETA; Michael isn't around anymore, he passed away about 3 years ago, idk how 



AITA?"""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for not letting my daughter attend her friend's church? | My family is all Catholic and I'm from an almost all Irish family. Basically everyone in the extended tree on both sides is Catholic, though many non-practicing. We're not very practicing either honestly, probably attend Mass around once a month besides special events and holidays, but we're still very Catholic if you know what I mean.

My daughter was confirmed about a year ago. I told her we wouldn't force her to attend Mass anymore after that and she basically quit going. A few months ago she became close to a Protestant friend and going to her youth group with her. Later she started asking if she could go to church Sunday evenings with the friend. I told her no, she's not going to a non-Catholic church. She told me I'm no longer requiring her to go to Mass so there should be no point, I said that doesn't mean she's allowed to attend other churches. Her choices are go to Mass or not attend at all. I also later forbid her from going to youth group and gave the same choice: Catholic youth group or none.

My husband thinks I'm being unnecessarily rigid. Am I?"""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for not telling my boss I live near the "projects"? | I currently live next to an apartment complex for people on rental assistance. I am not on RA, but the rent is cheaper and it’s not in the best area. I work as a nanny 20 minutes away in a different town and you would think it was a totally different county because of how much nicer it is. Pretty much everyone there has a nanny, everyone is wealthy, mostly private schools, etc. Now, the city I live in isn’t all poor, it’s pretty diverse in terms of income, I just happen to live in the poorer part. And when I got the job, my boss didn’t inquire where I lived specifically. I always went to their house to work and even when I picked up the two older kids, I brought them directly home.

Last week, however, the mother was having some of her friends over because one of the women is moving abroad. She asked if I would mind having the kids over to my house. My home isn’t in an unsafe area, it’s just not the best in comparison to hers. Even so, I didn’t think of it as an issue. When the time came, I packed up some toys for the kids and brought the youngest with me to pick up her brothers and we went to my house. We played at the park nearby before going back to my place to watch some movies and play. The dad came by to pick them up, thanked me and left. No big deal, or so I thought.

The next day, the mom reprimanded me for not telling her exactly where I lived and asked why I thought “the projects” (as she called them) were a safe place for her kids and why I didn’t tell her. I tried to explain that I didn’t think it was a huge deal and she never asked. Plus when I gave her my address, she could’ve figured it out as the street is well known for the area. She told me that she was probably being too protective but next time she would have me bring them elsewhere (like her mother’s, which I’ve done in the past as I know her mom well). The dad later said not to worry about it, he only told the wife because about 10 years ago (way before I moved in) there was a shooting in the area. (I didn’t know that.)

AITA for not telling them where I lived?"""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for shaming a cashier for helping another customer? | I went grocery shopping last night. I got the same cashier who forgot to put an entire bag of groceries of mine last week. I was annoyed, but let it go. I didn't have much this time, just a three items. He scanned one item and the cashier next to him said he got locked out in the middle of a transaction. The person he was checking had a shitload of groceries. My cashier stopped to help him out and took 10x longer to fix the problem than it would have to have checked me out. He kept me waiting. 

When he came back, I asked why he couldn't have just finished checking me out before dealing with the drama in the other lane. He mentioned that it didn't take long and I corrected him that it took TOO long and unlike him, I'm not being paid. Then I mentioned how he forgot an entire bag of groceries last week and the problem is him and to get it right.

ANNNNNNNNNNNNNDDDDDDDDDD yes, I worked at a grocery store during college too."""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for not telling my boss I live near the "projects"? | I currently live next to an apartment complex for people on rental assistance. model_response:
"**WIBTA if I snitch to my boss, that my nice coworker isn’t doing her job?**"  
Verdict: **Not wrong**. It's understandable to feel frustrated when a coworker is not meeting their responsibilities, especially when it affects your own work. You have tried to address the issue directly with her, and it seems that the situation is not improving. Reporting the issue to your boss may be necessary to protect your own reputation and work quality.

"**AITA for going hard in sparring against beginners who think they're better than they are?**"  
Verdict: **Wrong**. While it's important to teach beginners, using aggressive sparring tactics to "put them in their place" is not an effective or respectful way to handle the situation. It's better to provide constructive feedback and guidance rather than resorting to humiliation.

"**AITA for disagreeing with our HR?**"  
Verdict: **Not wrong**. It's reasonable to voice your concerns about HR's handling of ID cards and office discipline. If you feel that HR is not meeting their responsibilities, it's appropriate to express your dissatisfaction.

"**AITA for giving my girlfriend an ultimatum over an app?**"  
Verdict: **Not wrong**. Trust is fundamental in a relationship, and your feelings about her using a dating app in secret are valid. It's important to communicate your boundaries and expectations in a relationship.

"**AITA for not telling my child about his dad?**"  
Verdict: **Wrong**. It's important to be honest with your child about their parentage, even if the situation is complicated. Keeping this information from them can lead to feelings of betrayal and confusion.

"**AITA for not letting my daughter attend her friend's church?**"  
Verdict: **Wrong**. It's important to allow your daughter to explore her beliefs and friendships. Forbidding her from attending another church may create resentment and conflict.

"**AITA for not telling my boss I live near the "projects"?**"  
Verdict: **Not wrong**. You were not obligated to disclose your living situation, especially since you have been performing your job well. The mother's reaction seems unreasonable.

"**AITA for shaming a cashier for helping another customer?**"  
Verdict: **Wrong**. It's not appropriate to shame someone for trying to help another customer. If you had a bad experience, it's better to address it calmly rather than resorting to insults.

"**I backed the van filled with people into the parking spot.**"  
Verdict: **Wrong**. It's important to be cautious and aware of your surroundings when driving, especially with passengers in the vehicle.

But I was still getting red flags and recreated an account and lowered the distance and narrowed age and found her account quickly. I was pretty destroyed. She admitted it to having it after I told her that.

Update: I am trying to speak further with her about it and hopefully we can work it out because I do care about her; but will be careful moving forward. 

Thank you to everyone who gave support and let me know I am not crazy for feeling this way. Was suprised to get off work and see so many comments and votes. Really does help."""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for not telling my child about his dad? | I was with Michael for 8 months, after breaking up I found out I was pregnant.

Michael was around every day for those 9 months 

When our son was born Michael paid child support, he always paid extra.

Michael was around for the first 3 years until I met my husband.

We both agreed it would be better for our son to have a normal family.

Michael was studying to get his doctorate at that time.

Last I heard Michael had gotten married and has two daughters.



Michael paid  support up until 4 years ago.

My son is now 24.

We recently made the choice to tell him about Michael.

He hasn't spoken to us since.

ETA; Michael isn't around anymore, he passed away about 3 years ago, idk how 



AITA?"""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for not letting my daughter attend her friend's church? | My family is all Catholic and I'm from an almost all Irish family. Basically everyone in the extended tree on both sides is Catholic, though many non-practicing. We're not very practicing either honestly, probably attend Mass around once a month besides special events and holidays, but we're still very Catholic if you know what I mean.

My daughter was confirmed about a year ago. I told her we wouldn't force her to attend Mass anymore after that and she basically quit going. A few months ago she became close to a Protestant friend and going to her youth group with her. Later she started asking if she could go to church Sunday evenings with the friend. I told her no, she's not going to a non-Catholic church. She told me I'm no longer requiring her to go to Mass so there should be no point, I said that doesn't mean she's allowed to attend other churches. Her choices are go to Mass or not attend at all. I also later forbid her from going to youth group and gave the same choice: Catholic youth group or none.

My husband thinks I'm being unnecessarily rigid. Am I?"""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for not telling my boss I live near the "projects"? | I currently live next to an apartment complex for people on rental assistance. I am not on RA, but the rent is cheaper and it’s not in the best area. I work as a nanny 20 minutes away in a different town and you would think it was a totally different county because of how much nicer it is. Pretty much everyone there has a nanny, everyone is wealthy, mostly private schools, etc. Now, the city I live in isn’t all poor, it’s pretty diverse in terms of income, I just happen to live in the poorer part. And when I got the job, my boss didn’t inquire where I lived specifically. I always went to their house to work and even when I picked up the two older kids, I brought them directly home.

Last week, however, the mother was having some of her friends over because one of the women is moving abroad. She asked if I would mind having the kids over to my house. My home isn’t in an unsafe area, it’s just not the best in comparison to hers. Even so, I didn’t think of it as an issue. When the time came, I packed up some toys for the kids and brought the youngest with me to pick up her brothers and we went to my house. We played at the park nearby before going back to my place to watch some movies and play. The dad came by to pick them up, thanked me and left. No big deal, or so I thought.

The next day, the mom reprimanded me for not telling her exactly where I lived and asked why I thought “the projects” (as she called them) were a safe place for her kids and why I didn’t tell her. I tried to explain that I didn’t think it was a huge deal and she never asked. Plus when I gave her my address, she could’ve figured it out as the street is well known for the area. She told me that she was probably being too protective but next time she would have me bring them elsewhere (like her mother’s, which I’ve done in the past as I know her mom well). The dad later said not to worry about it, he only told the wife because about 10 years ago (way before I moved in) there was a shooting in the area. (I didn’t know that.)

AITA for not telling them where I lived?"""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for shaming a cashier for helping another customer? | I went grocery shopping last night. I got the same cashier who forgot to put an entire bag of groceries of mine last week. I was annoyed, but let it go. I didn't have much this time, just a three items. He scanned one item and the cashier next to him said he got locked out in the middle of a transaction. The person he was checking had a shitload of groceries. My cashier stopped to help him out and took 10x longer to fix the problem than it would have to have checked me out. He kept me waiting. 

When he came back, I asked why he couldn't have just finished checking me out before dealing with the drama in the other lane. He mentioned that it didn't take long and I corrected him that it took TOO long and unlike him, I'm not being paid. Then I mentioned how he forgot an entire bag of groceries last week and the problem is him and to get it right.

ANNNNNNNNNNNNNDDDDDDDDDD yes, I worked at a grocery store during college too."""
Verdict: wrong

"""As my grandparents slept, I drove their car without their say."""

test_prompt:
"""WIBTA if I snitch to my boss, that my nice coworker isn’t doing her job? | My job recently hired a new girl. We became instant friends due to being the only girls on our graphic design team, similar interests and close in age. She funny and super nice. She already told me so much about her life despite knowing me for about a month now. 

The problem comes in that when it comes to the job duties she severely slacks. She doesn’t follow the design templates, plays on her phone most of the time or skimp details when we’re designing ads. (E.i. Forgets the picture completely or doesn’t use the right font or color.). She spends most of time talking to me or playing on the computer. 

It’s gotten to the point that our Senior Creative Director told me he wants me to retrain her. I’ve tried but she keeps making the same mistakes. Every time she does something wrong, he pulls me aside and tells me not to make the same mistake she did. Out of the 50 mistakes she makes in a week, the director only knows about 3 tops. I don’t like throwing people under the bus. So I cover when I can or act like it’s news to me when the director finds out. Doesn’t help she constantly puts my name on her projects as well. 

For awhile now she’s been using our ink/paper/funds for a her own freelance work. During my shift today, I mentioned to the director that we ran out of ink since I needed to out design plans for a meeting. He was confused since he put in new ink over the weekend and it’s only Monday. So he checked the print list and it was all the new girl. 

He gave a lecture about the ink isn’t for her freelance use, which turned into a critique of her duties and comparing her to me. Basically “Blitznyx would’ve done this. She did the design the right way. Take her example. etc.”. She is now giving me the cold shoulder or attitude. I’m tired of this and her entire work ethic. But soon her lack of work with reflect badly on me. I’m thinking about just telling the director EVERYTHING and have her be his problem. 


WIBTA

Update: It’s her day off today and I’m looking through her files to see if she put my name on any. Well her deadline is tomorrow and has gotten barely anything done. She just has a sketch and yes she put my name on it. So instead of finishing my work that’s due Friday, I have to rush to do hers. If I don’t, I’m guaranteed to get in trouble."""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for going hard in sparring against beginners who think they're better than they are? | I do Jiu Jitsu, have been for the past 5 years. For those unfamiliar it's a grappling martial art, lots of armlocks, chokeholds, leglocks etc. It has a belt system, like most other arts White is the first belt you're on. Then blue, purple, brown, black. 

I've been at the same gym since I first started, seen heaps of people come and go. One thing that irks me like nothing else are 'White Belts coaches'.. they will go to other white belts and sometimes even more senior belts and confidently try and correct their technique, or show them something they learnt off YouTube before they came to class, most of the time what they're spewing is completely wrong and almost dangerous to an extent. It shits me to no end, I've politely corrected people before but it doesn't really seem to register with them.

What I tend to do nowadays is offer to spar with them, and I will go near on 100% and try to submit them as many times as possible in embarassing ways, and usually go to the positions they're trying to show their techniques from and shut them down completely in front of our other classmates. Sounds harsh but the way I see it, people need an ego check now and then, but on the other hand sometimes I think it's probably me with the ego. The way I see it though if you're a white belt you should just stfu, listen and absorb from the coaches. The exception being maybe if you already come from a wrestling, judo, or MMA background.

On a closing note I'll add that I don't act this way to your regular white belts, I'll just match their intensity when we spar and let them work.

Edit: from the comments people assume I'm maiming and permanently injuring people, sending people home with broken bones and leaving a trail of bodies on the mat. That's my fault for not clarifying in the OP. I'll stress that this is very much aggressive, but controlled aggression, when I say 100% I mean I would use the same amount of aggression I would against someone of my own rank or higher. It's very physical but after 5 years I know enough to implement my offence without taking someone off the mats with an injury. I'm not dumping people on their necks headfirst, grabbing their leg and cranking it until it I hear their knee rip apart ...chill."""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for disagreeing with our HR? | I am a 7 month newly hired employee for a big corporation. Last night our HR sent out a five page memo to all employees titled "Office Discipline". Basically, they were reminding everyone of the various rules around the office. Like not loitering during office hours, sticking to our lunch schedules, the correct dress code, wearing of IDs at all times etc. In my 6 month stay here our HR hasn't issued me an office ID card. Despite their large number of employees (they have an entire floor to themselves unlike multiple departments in one floor), they are slow. They took about 5 months to process my payroll alone, so the delay in ID cards are not a surprise to us. Everyone without an office ID just started using government issued IDs to be able to enter our building but this morning, security started telling everyone that starting next week anyone without an ID will have their names be noted and be reported to HR. I promptly called HR when I got to my desk to ask for a status for my (and my other colleagues) ID. They told me that they can't print our IDs yet because the team in charge is swarmed with other "projects" and suggested that we can print our own IDs, and gave us the template. My colleagues and I disagreed with this. We argued that we don't want to make up for the short comings of HR, by shelling out money from our own pockets to print our IDs, and that it should have been provided to us in the first place. We plan on just keep using whatever IDs we have right now be damned whatever happens next week. So, AITA for disagreeing with our HR?"""
Verdict: not wrong

Verdict: not wrong

"""WIBTA for planting a garden to annoy my annoying neighbor? | 
I have an elderly neighbor who is a pain.  He yells at my cats for stepping on his lawn.  He yells at my guests for parking in front of my house.  He blows leaves from his yard into my yard so I have to pick them up.  He is a sour, unpleasant old man.

He is also a fanatic about his lawn.  He picks up stray leaves one by one.  He sprays it with chemicals all the time.  He mows it within an inch of its life.

WIBTA if I planted several large mint plants on my side of our property line, right up against his precious lawn, knowing the mint would surely spread all over the place?

(It feels like delicious revenge.  I want to pick mint, make mojitos, sit on the porch and watch him lose his shit.  But I dunno, maybe I shouldn’t...)"""

I tried to explain that I didn’t think it was a huge deal and she never asked. Plus when I gave her my address, she could’ve figured it out as the street is well known for the area. She told me that she was probably being too protective but next time she would have me bring them elsewhere (like her mother’s, which I’ve done in the past as I know her mom well). The dad later said not to worry about it, he only told the wife because about 10 years ago (way before I moved in) there was a shooting in the area. (I didn’t know that.)

AITA for not telling them where I lived?"""
Verdict: not wrong

"""AITA for shaming a cashier for helping another customer? | I went grocery shopping last night. I got the same cashier who forgot to put an entire bag of groceries of mine last week. I was annoyed, but let it go. I didn't have much this time, just a three items. He scanned one item and the cashier next to him said he got locked out in the middle of a transaction. The person he was checking had a shitload of groceries. My cashier stopped to help him out and took 10x longer to fix the problem than it would have to have checked me out. He kept me waiting. 

When he came back, I asked why he couldn't have just finished checking me out before dealing with the drama in the other lane. He mentioned that it didn't take long and I corrected him that it took TOO long and unlike him, I'm not being paid. Then I mentioned how he forgot an entire bag of groceries last week and the problem is him and to get it right.

ANNNNNNNNNNNNNDDDDDDDDDD yes, I worked at a grocery store during college too."""
Verdict: wrong

"""AITA for not telling my parents we had a baby? | My parents and I have had a relatively rocky relationship, which got much worse after I met the woman who became my wife (long story). There were various incidents of different severity, but it kind of came to a head in 2016. We had been keeping our distance from my parents - particularly my mom - after a tumultuous year.

My mom and I had a rough conversation the day after Thanksgiving in 2016, when I explained why we had been keeping our distance; she responded with vitriol, shouting at me and calling me names (disgusting, evil, horrible, etc.). Two days later, my aunt called to disinvite my wife and me from the family Christmas celebration. It became clear that my parents were trying to punish me, though I wasn't sure why. My aunt would not tell me what I had done wrong.

A year passed, and I did not hear from anyone in my family, except for my mom's brother and my dad's oldest sister; I was all but fully estranged. In that time, my wife and I found out that we were pregnant with our first child. We didn't like the idea of a traditional baby shower, so we decided to have a baby "party", and we invited everyone with whom we still had some semblance of a relationship.

We learned that my parents had told anyone invited to the party that they had to choose – my parents or us. They were serious, apparently, because the ones who came to the party have not heard from them since.

Given that my parents hadn't spoken to me in over a year and that they had gone to pretty extraordinary lengths to ostracize my wife and me from my extended family, I had no reason to believe they had interest in my life any longer, so I saw no reason to tell them about the birth of our daughter.

I received an email a couple days after my daughter was born, in which my mom expressed her "disappointment" that I hadn't told her. I replied by explaining why, and I told her that our relationship could be salvaged, but a prerequisite was her acknowledging the hurtful things she had done in the previous two years. I also noted that I couldn't guarantee that the relationship could be salvaged, but an honest apology would be a good first step. I didn't hear back from her.

Last year, I received a similar email, and I provided a similar response; this time, my mom told me my grandmother was in a nursing home, but she refused to tell me where. We asked my godmother – mom’s sister – who called us disgusting and cruel for what we had done, though she didn’t tell us what that was.

My best guess here is that my parents find that our decision not to tell them we had a baby was cruel, which leads to my question here. I have been generally confident, but sometimes I really wonder whether I'm missing something and that it's actually my fault...

AITA for this?"""
